server_start.py¶

Module for starting the server.

Using.

The module supports command line arguments:

‘-p’, ‘–port’ - The port on which connections are accepted. ‘-a’, ‘–address’ - The address from which connections are received.

Examples of using:

python3 server.py -p 8080

Starting the server on port 8080.

python server.py -a 127.0.0.1

Starting the server accepting only connections to localhost.

server.server_start.main()¶

Include functions for creating a server settings dialog box (server_config) and saving settings (save_server_config).
